titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Joseph Levy Collection of Victoriana
titlestmt.author: Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 04:37

did.unittitle: Charles Joseph Levy Collection of Victoriana

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Charles Joseph Levy Collection of Victoriana contains printed material, including clippings, advertisements, and pictorial works; other ephemera, including objects; and a small amount of manuscript material, nearly all dating from the reign of Queen Victoria (1837-1901).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This finding aid was produced in 2014 from information supplied with the collection, including Charles Joseph Levy's list of the collection contents and original folder titles. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during basic processing.
Former call number: Uncat MS Vault 845.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles Joseph Levy Collection of Victoriana. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four groups: I. Ephemera; II. Ephemera - Addenda; III. Material Not Listed by Levy; IV. Objects.

The collection is arranged in the order in which it was received. The descriptive categories and item descriptions are taken almost entirely from the original inventory by Charles Joseph Levy; no attempt has been made to standardize the language or style of the entries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Charles Joseph Levy Collection of Victoriana contains printed material, including clippings, advertisements, and pictorial works; other ephemera, including objects; and a small amount of manuscript material, nearly all dating from the reign of Queen Victoria (1837-1901).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 12 (glass negatives): Restricted Fragile Material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Charles Joseph Levy Collection of Victoriana is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Charles Joseph Levy Collection of Victoriana is the gift of Charles Joseph Levy, 1977 and 1980.

controlaccess.subject: Victoriana
controlaccess.geogname: Great Britain -- Social life and customs -- 19th century
controlaccess.genreform: Ephemera (general object genre) -- Great Britain -- 19th century

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following are included: - The Stone of Destiny, Valentine & Son, London - Tombstone of Peter Isnell (died 1811 March 31) - American Indian and explorer - L. L. A. A. R. R. I Principi di Savoia - Crown Princess Louise - Crown Prince Olau - Norwegian king and queen - Koningin Wilhelmina - Charles II, Westminster Abbey - Earl of Leicester - Prince Charles Edward Stuart - Peers paying homage to the king - Chair from the Victoria and Albert museum - Needlework chair seat from the Victoria and Albert museum - The Great Well Carisbrooke - Charles Dickens and characters calendar from 1911 - "Wishing you a joyful Easter-tide," 1915 April 2 (postmark) - Arm chair from the Victoria and Albert museum - Drawing of a man with a top hat, 1882 July 27 (postmark) - "Merry Goes the Time," by O. Stockman for Pearl's milk-blended butter

did.unittitle: Advertising Material
2 tradesman's cards
2 bookmarks - Great Western Railway, "Holiday Haunts," and Northern of London and Aberdeen Fire, Life, Accident, and Burglary Insurance Co.
2 labels - Rose Soap and Belfast Linens
Price list of European newspapers and magazines
9 "Heroes of History" cards from Miners Extra Smoking Tobacco and Royal Bengals Little Cigars
3 cigar bands
27 Kensitas Cigarette "cards" - flags of the British empire, printed on satin
Portraits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following are included: - Princess Victoria at 18 - Queen Victoria from the Royal London Wax Museum - Mark Twain - Water-color portrait believed to be the lost miniature of Shelley by Edward Ellerker Williams - Professor Tyndall - Caricature of "Bobby Lowe" - Sir Charles Wheatstone - The Earl of Rosslyn, Mr. James Erskine - Admiral Inglefield - The Bishop of Ripon - Caricature of Mr. J. Ashby Sterry, the lazy minstrel - His Majesty the King, 1911 - The King and Queen shortly after their marriage - King George as Vice-Admiral in 1903 - View from behind of a seated man wearing a hat - Caricature of "Rivals Thackeray and Dickens" - The late Napolean III, Ex-Emperor of France - Winston Churchill - Will Carleton, author of "Betsey and I are Out" - Queen Victoria, one month before her death (1901) - George Charles, 7th Duke of Marlborough; Frances Anne, Duchess of Marlborough - Queen Victoria, William Gladstone, The Marquis of Salisbury, Benjamin Disraeli (separate portraits on one clipping) - Lord Randolph Churchill and his caricature - Lord Randolph S. Churchill, circa 1874; Jennie R. Churchill (separate portraits on one clipping) - Lord Randolph Churchill, 1893

did.unittitle: Portraits - Oversize

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following are included: - The Right Hon. Sir Alexander Cockburn - Simon Ward, actor, as Winston Churchill - Winston Churchill and Harry S. Truman, 1952 - The Right Hon. William Evart Gladstone, Premier of England - Lord Lytton - The Right Hon. John Bright, M. P. - Mark Twain, with a list of some famous quotes - "The Old Queen"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following are included: - Black and white print of "Stanley shooting the rapids of the Congo" - Black and white print of "Rosa Bonhuer" - Black and white print of "The Prodigal Son" - Black and white print of "York and Lancaster - The White and Red Roses" - Black and white print of "Dr. Johnson's Penance" - Black and white print of "Tennyson in his library" - Black and white print of "Gordon attacked by El Mahdi's Arabs" - Black and white print of "The death of Chatterton, the young poet" - Black and white print of "Last Scene of All," plate 6 of Hogarth's Marriage a la Mode - Black and white print of "I love thee because thou art daring" - Black and white print of "Gladstone's first home rule bill" - Black and white print of a tower house on a cliff in moonlight - Black and white print of "But he gave us glory" - Black and white print of "The Fatal Duel," plate 5 of Hogarth's Marriage a la Mode - Small print of street vendors - Small print of schoolboy - Color reproduction of "Charlie the Cox" - Black and white print of "Ludgate Circus," circa 1860 - Black and white print of "The Observatory, Greenwich" - Black and white reproduction of the front cover of A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens - 2 black and white reproductions of the title page of A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens - Color print of "Knighthood: Mantles and Insignia of the Principal British Orders of Knighthood" - Black and white print of Eaton, Lower School - Black and white print of the boys at Dotheboys Hall, where Nicholas Nickleby was master - Color print of "The White and the Red Rose" - Illustrated poem in color, "The Happy Home" - Color print of "The Atlantic Telegraph" - "The Dying Words and Confession of Elias Lucas and Mary Reader" - "Education...at Bowe's Academy," reproduction of an advertisting notice - "Mrs. Hartley's School for Young Ladies," reproduction of an advertisting notice

Color print of "The Cutler's Monthly Journal of London and Paris Fashions for December 1856" - "Hogarth House Gem Pocket Library," reproduction of an advertisement - Color print of "And now let Mr. Lambkin speak for himself..." - Black and white print of "Battle School, Sussex," 1847 - Black and white print of "Trinity College," 1842 - Black and white print of "London Foundling Hospital" - Black and white print of "Staple's Inn" - Black and white print of "Street Front of the Fleet Prison" - Black and white print of "Courtyard in the Fleet Prison" - Black and white print of "Wedding in the Fleet" - Black and white print of "The Last Remains of the Fleet Prison" - Black and white print of "Banard's Inn" - Black and white print of "There's life in the old dog yet," mounted - Black and white print of "The Wood-Engraver" - Black and white print of "Nobility" - Black and white print of "December, as depicted by George Cruikshank in the comic almanack for 1835" - Black and white print of "The Lecture room at the Royal Institution, London" - Black and white print of "Holyrood Palace, Edinburgh"

scopecontent.p: The following are included: - Benjamin Disraeli depicted as the ghost of Harrington - Lord Beaconsfield - Benjamin Disraeli caricature with caption, "One Ward for the Fenien Prisoners, and how many for the 'Shaughraum?'" - Print of Benjamin Disraeli, Earl of Beaconsfield - Lord Beaconsfield, from the painting by Sir J. E. Millair, Rischgitz Collection - The Earl of Beaconsfield, from the painting by Sir J. E. Millair, National Portrait Gallery - Benjamin Disraeli, after the portrait by A. E. Challon (2 copies) - "Disraeli," from an etching by Pilotell - The Earl of Beaconsfield, from a photo by Hughes and Mullins - Lord Beaconsfield - "Benjamin Disraeli, Earl of Beaconsfield" - "The Right Hon. Benjamin Disraeli, M. P." - "The Earl of Beaconsfield" - "Lord Beaconsfield at the Lord Mayor's Banquet in Guildhall, London" - "The Queen's visit to Hughenden: At Hight Wycombe Railway Station," [1877 December 15] - "Hughenden Manor, Buckinghamshire" - "Mr. Disraeli telling the House of Commons his story about 'dry champagne'" - "Lord Beaconsfield at the Banquet in Guildhall" - "Mr. Disraeli Introducing His Reform Bill in the House of Commons" - "Funeral of Lord Beaconsfield at Hughenden" (2 copies) - "Peace with Honor: Reception of Lord Beaconsfield and Lord Salisbury at Charing Cross" - "Hughenden Church" (2 copies) - Hughenden Manor, Buckinghamshire - Disraeli, Benjamin: biographical sketch - Clipping about "Primrose Day," 1886 April 19 - "Was the Earl of Beaconsfield a Representative Jew?"

M. S. Collingwood, 1882 November 22 - Calendar back: Shakespere Calendar, London, 1900 - Calendar back: The Tennyson Calendar, London, Marcus Ward & Co., 1895 - Admission ticket to the Royal Colosseum, 1863 - "Places of Interest near Inverness," The Station Hotel, Inverness - Printed program of toasts, Royal Agricultural Society of England - 4 cards soliciting aid for an orphan, Hilda Jane Hughes, British Orphan Society - 2 calling cards of Mr. Sherlock Holmes - 2 calling cards of J. H. Watson, M. D. - Stationery from "The Gladstone," Narragansett Pier, Rhode Island - Wedding breakfast invitation - Guide to H. M. S. Inflexible - Fink, Clarence M.: Typescript of "Barking up the Wrong Tree" - Anderson, Chester G.: Photocopy of typescript, "Curse you, George Orwell! Or, Should Boys have Sweethearts?" - Shell-decorated pocket notebook - "The American War in 1779," extract from Political Magazine, 1870 August, printed on satin - Christmas card to "Dear Alfred" (Prince Alfred of Saxe-Cobury) - Clipping of photograph of the Late H. 19th century American Authors - Autographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following are included: - Hannah More, on paper, accompanied by a print - Francis Marion Crawford, on a photograph - Dusven, on card - Cyrus W. Field, on card - M. A. Harnig, on card - Edmund C. Stedman, on card - J. N. Wainaenighlo, on tag - D. Wilmot, on paper

did.unittitle: Advertising Material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following are included: - Noble Thoughts from Tennyson Calendar, 1894 - Every Day Calendar, Marcus Ward and Co., London, 1891 - Wittier Calendar, Houghton Mifflin, Boston, 1887 - Lowell Calendar, Houghton Mifflin, Boston, 1885 - Tradecard for Singer Manufacturing Co., 1891 - Advertising card for S. H. Street and Co., June Calendar

did.unittitle: Advertisting Material - Oversize

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following are included: - Catalogue of Trimmed Hats, Western Bargain Millinery Company, Chicago - Calendar advertisement for the Grand Union Tea Co., Brooklyn, New York, 1900

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following are included: - Poem, "The Absent-Minded Beggar," printed in manuscript form with the signature of Rudyard Kipling, 1899 - Poem, "On the Inestimable Timing," written on a lace doily, 1851 December 16 - Official score card, World Championship Series, 1889 - Card game, Portrait Authors, Noyes and Snow, Worcester, Massachusetts, 1873 - Elementary School Certificate for Alice A. Merrill, 1922 June 16 - Card of British flag with manuscript note: bon voyage - Assorted Christmas cards - Victorian valentines

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 12 (glass negatives): Restricted Fragile Material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
